meanings.definition: A type of single-celled organism that lacks a cell nucleus and is considered to be one of the oldest forms of life on Earth.
meanings.sent1: The archaebacterium was found in extreme environments.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study archaebacteria to learn about early life forms.
meanings.sent3: The archaebacterium threw a tiny party in its cell.
meanings.sent4: In the world of microorganisms, the archaebacterium stands as a resilient survivor.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the archaebacterium appeared ancient and mysterious.
